revised_title: Uncommon Case of a Distempered Skin: A Unique Medical Condition
tldr: A boy from Suffolk has a unique skin condition where his skin turns into a thick, dark, and bristly covering, resembling the bark of a tree or elephant skin. The covering grows every year and is shed once a year in autumn. The boy's health is otherwise normal, and the cause of this condition remains unknown. This case study provides a detailed description of the boy's appearance and the texture of his unusual skin.
